text: Trachycardium isocardia, the West Indian prickly cockle, is a species of bivalve mollusc in the family Cardiidae. It can be found along coast of the West Indies.Abbott, R.T. & Morris, P.A. A Field Guide to Shells: Atlantic and Gulf Coasts and the West Indies. New York: Houghton Mifflin, 1995. 57-58. ==References== Category:Cardiidae Category:Molluscs described in 1758 Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus
title: Trachycardium isocardia
